objects.name: Whiteboard
descriptions: A smooth surface for writing or drawing using dry-erase markers.
Used in classrooms and offices for presenting information.
A reusable board for brainstorming ideas and planning.
additional_descriptions: A versatile tool for visualizing concepts and organizing thoughts.
A clean, writable surface perfect for quick note-taking or illustrating ideas.

objects.name: Solar_System_Name_Tag
descriptions: A label or tag designed to represent or identify objects within the solar system.
Typically includes the names of planets, moons, stars, or other celestial bodies.
Used for educational, decorative, or organizational purposes in schools, museums, or space-related exhibits.
additional_descriptions: Used for educational purposes to identify solar system bodies.
A useful tool to help understand and organize the vast expanse of space.

objects.name: Chair_Stand
descriptions: A functional piece of furniture designed to support a chair in a stable and elevated position.
Commonly used in offices, workshops, or other specialized settings to enhance ergonomics or storage.
additional_descriptions: Improves workspace organization by raising chairs off the floor.
Helps optimize desk space by elevating seating arrangements.

objects.name: Microscope
descriptions: A device used to magnify small objects or details.
Essential for studying microorganisms and cells.
Often used in labs for biological and material analysis.
additional_descriptions: A vital tool for scientific research and discovery.
Used to observe minute details invisible to the naked eye.

objects.name: Test_Tube_Mixer
descriptions: A device for mixing liquids within test tubes.
Commonly used in chemistry labs for experiments.
Ensures even mixing of solutions in test tubes.
additional_descriptions: Aids in maintaining consistency in chemical experiments.
An essential tool in laboratory settings for solution preparation.

objects.name: Lid
descriptions: A cover for a container to seal it.
Used to protect contents from spilling.
Often made of plastic or metal for durability.
additional_descriptions: Helps preserve freshness by sealing containers tightly.
Prevents contamination and keeps contents secure.

objects.name: Test_Tube
descriptions: A small cylindrical container used in scientific experiments.
Made of glass or plastic for holding liquids.
Essential for chemical and biological analysis.
additional_descriptions: Used for testing or mixing small quantities of substances.
A key tool in scientific research and experimental processes.

objects.name: Test_Tube_Spinner
descriptions: A tool for rotating or spinning test tubes for experiments.
Helps in separating substances by centrifugal force.
Often used in laboratory setups for precise experiments.
additional_descriptions: Facilitates faster and more efficient separation of materials.
Used for techniques like centrifugation in laboratory experiments.

objects.name: Tap
descriptions: A device to control the flow of liquids, typically water.
Often used in sinks and labs for dispensing water.
Can be turned on and off for controlled flow.
additional_descriptions: A convenient tool for managing liquid distribution.
Used in a variety of settings, from kitchens to laboratories.

objects.name: Fire_Extinguisher
descriptions: A device to extinguish fires in emergencies.
Contains chemicals to suppress flames effectively.
Essential safety equipment in buildings and labs.
additional_descriptions: A crucial safety tool in preventing or controlling fire outbreaks.
Provides immediate response during fire emergencies to limit damage.

objects.name: Chair
descriptions: A piece of furniture designed for sitting.
Can have various designs, including with or without armrests.
Used in offices, homes, and public spaces.
additional_descriptions: Available in a variety of materials, including wood, metal, and plastic.
Provides comfort and support for sitting over extended periods.

objects.name: Test_Tube_Holder
descriptions: A tool used to hold test tubes securely during experiments.
Prevents test tubes from tipping over or breaking.
Made of metal, plastic, or wood for stability.
additional_descriptions: An important safety tool in chemical and biological experiments.
Ensures secure handling of test tubes while conducting experiments.

objects.name: Table
descriptions: A flat surface supported by legs for various uses.
Used in labs for placing equipment or performing experiments.
Commonly made of wood, metal, or plastic.
additional_descriptions: Serves as the foundation for many types of workspaces.
Provides ample space for working, studying, or displaying items.

objects.name: Titration_Flask
descriptions: A flask used for titration in chemistry experiments.
Helps in determining concentrations of solutions.
Designed with a narrow neck for precise pouring.
additional_descriptions: A key tool in quantitative chemical analysis.
Used to mix solutions in precise quantities for reactions.

objects.name: Mesuring_Flask
descriptions: Another measuring flask for precise liquid measurement.
Calibrated for accuracy in experiments.
Essential for preparing standard solutions.
additional_descriptions: Often used in laboratories for preparing accurate chemical solutions.
Marked with measurement lines to ensure precision in liquid handling.

objects.name: Wall_And_Windows
descriptions: A wall structure that includes window openings.
Allows light and air to pass through.
Common in buildings for ventilation and natural lighting.
additional_descriptions: Provides shelter and support for structures.
Offers visual appeal and contributes to energy efficiency.

objects.name: Boiling_flask
descriptions: A round-bottom flask used for boiling liquids.
Designed to withstand high temperatures.
Common in distillation and heating experiments.
additional_descriptions: Ideal for heating volatile or chemical liquids.
Allows for even heating due to its round shape.

objects.name: Beaker
descriptions: A cylindrical container used for mixing and heating liquids.
Graduated markings for approximate measurements.
Essential in chemistry labs for handling chemicals.
additional_descriptions: Used for pouring, stirring, or heating liquids.
A fundamental tool in many laboratory procedures.

objects.name: Earth_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the Earth.
Often used in geography or astronomy education.
Shows continents, oceans, and major geographical features.
additional_descriptions: Used to illustrate Earth's rotation and position in the solar system.
Aids in understanding Earth's landforms and climate patterns.

objects.name: Earth_model_Stand
descriptions: A stand to hold the Earth model in place.
Provides stability for display or study.
Often adjustable for optimal viewing angles.
additional_descriptions: Keeps the Earth model secure during educational demonstrations.
Ensures that the model is easily visible and stable.

objects.name: Nuclear_Waste
descriptions: A representation of hazardous radioactive waste.
Typically contained in barrels for safety.
Symbolizes environmental and safety concerns.
additional_descriptions: Represents the importance of safe disposal methods.
Used in educational settings to raise awareness about environmental issues.

objects.name: Curtain
descriptions: A duplicate of a fabric curtain.
Used for blocking light or ensuring privacy.
Can be decorative or functional in nature.
additional_descriptions: Often used to enhance the aesthetic of a room.
Helps control the amount of natural light entering a space.

objects.name: Sun_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the Sun.
Shows solar activity or physical characteristics.
Often used in astronomy education.
additional_descriptions: Represents solar phenomena like sunspots and solar flares.
Used to demonstrate the Sun's role in the solar system.

objects.name: Mercury_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the planet Mercury.
Highlights surface features and position in the Solar System.
Used in educational displays or models.
additional_descriptions: Illustrates Mercury's proximity to the Sun and its lack of atmosphere.
Useful for demonstrating planetary characteristics.

objects.name: Venus_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the planet Venus.
Depicts surface details and atmospheric conditions.
Used in astronomy and planetary studies.
additional_descriptions: Displays Venus's thick cloud cover and extreme surface temperature.
Used in models to study planetary atmospheres.

objects.name: Mars_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the planet Mars.
Shows surface features like craters and valleys.
Often part of Solar System models or educational tools.
additional_descriptions: Used to teach about Mars's geography and its potential for human exploration.
Highlights Mars's red color due to iron oxide on its surface.

objects.name: Jupiter_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the planet Jupiter.
Highlights its Great Red Spot and cloud bands.
Used in educational and astronomy models.
additional_descriptions: Represents Jupiter's massive size and swirling storms.
Used for demonstrations of gas giants and their unique characteristics.

objects.name: Saturn_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the planet Saturn.
Depicts its iconic rings and gaseous surface.
Often included in planetary models for study.
additional_descriptions: Showcases Saturn's extensive ring system and its gas composition.
Used to teach about the outer planets and their features.

objects.name: Neptune_Model
descriptions: A miniature representation of the planet Neptune.
Highlights its deep blue color and atmospheric features.
Used in educational and astronomy projects.
additional_descriptions: Demonstrates Neptune's storm systems and its position in the outer solar system.
Used to study the farthest planet from the Sun and its unique conditions.

objects.name: Solar_System_Model
descriptions: A model representing the entire Solar System.
Shows planets, moons, and their relative positions.
Used for teaching astronomy and space science.
additional_descriptions: Aids in demonstrating the vast distances and scale of the solar system.
Used in classrooms to explore the relationship between the planets.

objects.name: Solar_System_Model_Stand
descriptions: A stand for holding the Solar System model.
Provides stability and ease of display.
Often adjustable for better visualization.
additional_descriptions: Ensures the Solar System model stays in position for educational purposes.
Provides a stable base for demonstrating the relative motion of planets.

objects.name: Carbon_Model
descriptions: A model representing a chemical compound, likely cyclohexane.
Useful for teaching molecular structures in chemistry.
Highlights atomic bonding and geometry.
additional_descriptions: Helps visualize molecular structures and bonding types.
Used to illustrate complex organic compounds in chemistry.

objects.name: Saturn
descriptions: Another representation of the planet Saturn.
Features its characteristic rings and gaseous surface.
Used in Solar System and planetary displays.
additional_descriptions: Features Saturn's distinct appearance and massive ring system.
Used to teach about the characteristics of gas giants.

objects.name: Room
descriptions: Wall structure with windows.
Allows natural light and ventilation.
Common in architectural and interior designs.
additional_descriptions: Represents a basic architectural design for living or working spaces.
Provides insight into the design and layout of interior spaces.

objects.name: Ceiling
descriptions: A horizontal surface that forms the upper boundary of a room.
Supports lighting fixtures or other ceiling decorations.
Can be made from various materials like plaster, drywall, or tiles.
In architectural designs, it serves both functional and aesthetic purposes.
